reviews.review_msg: I actually found kirsten really helpful and her lectures were always organized. Assignments are not very hard and quite straight foward.  She was very clear in what she wanted from her students. I find her more helpful than her TA because she clarifies concepts. The first half of the course is quite dry which is why some may not enjoy it.

Where to begin? Her lectures are uninformative, and super disorganized. She makes snarky comments during lecture and her assignments could not be less clear if they were written in pig latin. Actually they might make more sense that way. the only saving grace that I had was my TA who almost made up for her complete lack of teaching ability.
she gives very clear,well-organized and straight-forward lecs.i dunno y ppl put such harsh marks for her.i didn't get dat great mark :( but this course was veeeeeeeeeeeery useful

Easy course, though the material is a bit boring. Needs to work on lecturing skills b/c she tends to be repetitive and oversimplify concepts. Midterms and assignments are easy as long as you do all the readings and pay attn to her notes.

her teaching style needs serious adjustment.  I must say that her instructions for assignments are poor.    Her overhead notes are not a good guideline because she jumps back and forth from topic to topic.  If you decide to take the course make sure to be self-organized.
i think that the fact that she taught a history course should be taken into account. she may not have been entertaining (usually hist courses aren't) but i learned a lot of info that i can use later.

Wow... very very boring prof. My goodness. I fell asleep half the time, and didn't bother coming 1/4 of the time, leaving me only 1/4 of the time actually there and somewhat attentive. Her movies were cool though. But... yeah... boring. Also, read above.

I hate the class mostly because Kirsten is so confusing and repetitive. she doesnt take enough time for the larger topics. if you need help talk to the TA because she will make your problems worse. i cant stand her.

Her lectures are horribly slow and excruciating.  I have fallen asleep during them.  She reads off of her computer half of the time and fails to address the students in a effective manner.  Ironic, considering this is a COMMUNICATIONS course.

David is a great professor! He makes his class really interesting and creative, and he really cares for his students. The best prof I ever had by so far! He is very helpful. The workload seemed like a lot at first, but it is actually not and also interesting and engaging. Presentations are super important. Definitely recommend him!

great prof, loved the class. Highly recommend communication students to take this course with professor Newman. professor Newman is a very nice instructor , the activities were creative, and work load is fair, not too heavy but you will learn a lot.

Great class, rather interesting though I thought that since it was a history class it wouldn't be. The simulation game played in class was insightful but since it was new, not everything went as planned. Assignments are easy enough. Usually available for help, I would say email is best.
Good Prof. Interesting material. 1/2 of the marking comes from team presentations. Seems like a lot of workload at first but it is actually fair. NO final in this class.

I had Newman as a prof and as a TA. Cmns130 was hard to get through because the students in it were disrespectful which didn't help Newman's already dry lectures. He is however, very knowledgeable. Come to class prepared to listen. I liked Newman much better as a TA. He is a very good mediator and prepared us for midterms etc without boring us.

David was helpful, gave plenty of advice and useful information for both the midterm, final exam, and even non-course related subjects. If you did the readings the tutorials were overall enjoyable as you could follow along. The tutorials were mostly about class presentation on the weekly readings.

Stuart is awesome! The content for this course can be dry at times, but he does a great job at making it interesting by showing lots of movie clips and relating it to real world examples. Wants a lot of class participation but isn't awkward about it like some profs can be. Learned about half the class's names by the end of the semester. Love him!
Excellent prof. Gives great lectures, easy to understand and learn from!

Roman is by far the most engaging prof - he made lectures interesting and fun! It was the only lecture I actually looked forward to attending every week. He is a fair marker and he knows what he's talking about.

Extremely engaging prof, his lectures will never be boring! He really encourages self thinking, so the books we used for the semester don't make sense if you don't put in any effort with making the connections yourselves. Oh and there's an optional take home final--HELL YEAH!

This guy is a legend. I take classes with him whenever possible. Even though he retells the same stories over and over, he is easily the most knowledgeable, down to earth and entertaining prof you will ever have. He's an incredible speaker, which significantly lessens the work load since you're always engaged with the material. No pain, no pain!

The course covered very interesting topics. The Zielinsky and Ong text were absolutely wonderful. If you did the readings the midterm and final were very manageable. Roman gives entertaining lectures and he knows how to give a good presentation. He was helpful and gave me a wealth of useful information. This is one of the best course I have taken.
Awesome professor! Hilarious in lectures, very blunt and open professor that is extremely down to earth. Awesome lecturer and great knowledge in the field of Communications and Media History.

Fascinating lectures.  Most interesting prof I've ever had.  Rambles quite a bit, but gives you everything you need to do very well in the course.  If you want to actually enjoy your lectures, take one of his courses.
He's a really cool prof. Provides great insight to the history of communication. Makes lectures fun and is an easy-going person!
he is like the greatest professor i ever had. HE IS HILAAAAAAARIOUS ! i love him

He is such an enthusiastic prof. It is important to go to his lectures, because for that class specifically his mid term and exam is based off of the lecture material. Yet going to lecture is not a drag. He spoke well and delivered the concepts in an organized understandable fashion. He also repeats a lot of the main ideas. Would take again.

Exams and papers were all lecture based.  He says at the beginning of semester that they will be and readings are mostly just for participation marks in tutorial.  Good speaker and clear lectures but sometimes drags on.  If you want CMNS history take 210, but any new media interest you should probably stick to 253W
really passionate, Jamie is one of the best prof i've ever met in sfu. cant wait to attend his class every week since his class is extremely interesting.
Nice prof. Clear in class content and you will sure receive grade mark if you attend lecture.  Also provide helpful extra help outside classes. Greatest prof ever.

Loved this class, it was the most interesting one this semester and I was expecting another 110 disaster. Jaime is funny, nice, cool, and understanding. He is willing to give extensions to trusted students and met me at a coffee shop to talk about my essay. I would take any course with him and his AWESOME TA nick again.

class debate is a good way to understand the materials. When you engage in the debate, you will understand enough for the course, and the debate is not including in the marking. Presentations for each person is also a inspirational way to let you study hard. Well, if you followed all his steps, you should be ok for this.

I was a little bit nervous to take this class, as a lot of the materials looked really dense and a little dry, but Matthew made it really interesting and was great at breaking down the material in his lectures. His class really focused on class discussions of course concepts and materials, and he is great at facilitating group debate.
He is a nice and charming person. He helped me a lot with my term paper. Media History itself is a boring subject, but somehow he made it interesting!

He is an incredibly passionate instructor - and he has increased my interest in communications subjects immensely. If you haven't experienced his teaching style - you MUST. Very engaging lectures, phenomenal feedback on essays and an incredible willingness to listen to his students. GREAT PROF!!!!
